{"step_by_step_thinking": "Wilson's disease is a disorder of copper metabolism that can present with a variety of symptoms. According to the documents, common symptoms in children include liver disease, neurological symptoms, psychiatric disturbances, and hemolytic anemia (Document [0], [1], [2], [4], [5], [7], [8], [14], [15], [22], [25], [26], [29], [30]). Chronic active hepatitis is also a common manifestation of Wilson's disease in children (Document [30]). However, there is no mention of Fanconi syndrome or sensory changes as symptoms of Wilson's disease in children in any of the provided documents.", "answer_choice": "A. Fanconi syndrome"}
